item.title: Grey Mind
item.description: My room with some light Cast from many angles Where they land and where it goes So some becomes more Something and something else Tile and grout Wall against will Twisting in fractals Approaching themselves And away from some simultaneously Smaller and smaller connections Closer and closer, denser and denser Left and right All my neighbors So the synapses evolve where quanta resides

item.title: An Ode to Park Funding
item.description: The ocean is salty And ships are at sea If the lighthouse were open How happy I'd be But funding is missing We're locked out today We can't scale the lighthouse Cause Congress won't pay

item.title: Non-profundities (from a Macbook)
item.description: Most are a fan of far-fetched funny thoughts Some are well versed in profundities Some more get a kick out of anything Like me; I am fond of non-profundities What is it like to enjoy almost anything? Any a thing and a thought come to mind Except for pain and the loss and depression That once was my default, but I did subside

item.title: The Soldier
item.description: The soldier follows orders He does not question his commander His job is well defined - do what you're told He has no inherent direction, No goals or aspirations He is a machine, ready to be programmed When his training is complete, he can operate without fear or doubt. His goals are not his, they are predetermined. His general calls the shots, he simply aims and pulls the trigger.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to my website! Feel free to poke around and see some of my content and projects. I also have a resume if you’re interested in that sort of thing. In early 2017 I moved from Tennessee to San Francisco. Currently I work as a software engineer at Skupos, where we build point-of-sale integrations for convenience stores. I mostly work on the backend web services, but I have a reasonable amount of frontend experience as well.

item.title: Music
item.description: Soundcloud Here’s some singer-songwriter type material. Lonesome Still This is my current bluegrass band. I play guitar and dobro.

item.title: My Mantra
item.description: Life is beautiful Listen to music Play, Grow Work hard, work out Eat healthy Learn from others Be gracious Love is out there

item.title: While True
item.description: I haven't done so and such in a little while What's a once in a while that is any more than a little? It must be a long while, longer than the littlest little while A cardinality all its own, an infinity of sorts Discovered once a moment Infinitesimally summed across a minute Integral to all we've been through All we'll be through

item.title: How to test dark mode?
item.description: You can set dark mode as default by setting params.mode to dark in config.toml or set it to auto which will detect based on your OS and switch to dark mode. For more details refer documentation Here is how you can switch based on your OS iOS Android macOS Windows 10

item.title: Getting Started with Traveling Ultralight
item.description: I’m on a trip at the moment, and a friend who generously let me sleep on his couch looked at my small travel backpack and commented on how little I travel with: “That’s impressive,” he said. I was a little surprised, because though I’ve gotten that comment before, it’s become normal for me to travel with just a small bag (10 lbs. or less, usually), and I have friends who travel with even less.

item.title: How I Learned to Stop Procrastinating, & Love Letting Go
item.description: The end of procrastination is the art of letting go. I’ve been a lifelong procrastinator, at least until recent years. I would put things off until deadline, because I knew I could come through. I came through on tests after cramming last minute, I turned articles in at the deadline after waiting until the last hour, I got things done. Until I didn’t. It turns out procrastinating caused me to miss deadlines, over and over.

item.title: Fearlessness: How to Stop Running from Space
item.description: We spend our days filling in every available space, cramming in more tasks, responding to messages, checking social media and online sites, watching videos. We are afraid of empty space in our lives. The result is often a continual busyness, constant distraction and avoidance, lack of focus, lack of satisfaction with our lives. We run from silence. We run from the spaces between tasks and appointments. We run from solitude and stillness.

item.title: Primer: When You Have Too Much to Do
item.description: You have a to-do list that scrolls on for days. You are managing multiple projects, getting lots of email and messages on different messaging systems, managing finances and personal health habits and so much more. It all keeps piling up, and it can feel overwhelming. How do you keep up with it all? How do you find focus and peace and get stuff accomplished when you have too much on your plate?
